trans-unit.target: <properties pageTitle="Managing Assets and Related Entities with Media Services .NET SDK" description="Learn how to manage assets and related entities with the Media Services SDK for .NET." authors="juliako" manager="dwrede" editor="" services="media-services" documentationCenter=""/>

trans-unit.source: <tags ms.service="media-services" ms.workload="media" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/11/2015" ms.author="juliako"/>
trans-unit.target: <tags ms.service="media-services" ms.workload="media" ms.tgt_pltfrm="na" ms.devlang="na" ms.topic="article" ms.date="08/11/2015" ms.author="juliako"/>

trans-unit.source: This topic shows how to accomplish the following Media Services management tasks:
trans-unit.target: This topic shows how to accomplish the following Media Services management tasks:

trans-unit.source: Get an asset reference
trans-unit.target: Get an asset reference

trans-unit.source: Get a job reference
trans-unit.target: Get a job reference

trans-unit.source: List all assets
trans-unit.target: List all assets

trans-unit.source: List jobs and assets
trans-unit.target: List jobs and assets

trans-unit.source: List all access policies
trans-unit.target: List all access policies

trans-unit.source: List All Locators
trans-unit.target: List All Locators

trans-unit.source: Delete an asset
trans-unit.target: Delete an asset

trans-unit.source: Delete a job
trans-unit.target: Delete a job

trans-unit.source: Delete an access policy
trans-unit.target: Delete an access policy

trans-unit.source: See <linkText>Set up your environment</linkText><title></title>
trans-unit.target: See <linkText>Set up your environment</linkText><title></title>

trans-unit.source: A frequent task is to get a reference to an existing asset in Media Services.
trans-unit.target: A frequent task is to get a reference to an existing asset in Media Services.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how you can get an asset reference from the Assets collection on the server context object, based on an asset Id.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows how you can get an asset reference from the Assets collection on the server context object, based on an asset Id.

trans-unit.source: The following code example uses a Linq query to get a reference to an existing IAsset object.
trans-unit.target: The following code example uses a Linq query to get a reference to an existing IAsset object.

trans-unit.source: When you work with processing tasks in Media Services code, you often need to get a reference to an existing job based on an Id.
trans-unit.target: When you work with processing tasks in Media Services code, you often need to get a reference to an existing job based on an Id.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to get a reference to an IJob object from the Jobs collection.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows how to get a reference to an IJob object from the Jobs collection.

trans-unit.source: WarningWarning You may need to get a job reference when starting a long-running encoding job, and need to check the job status on a thread.
trans-unit.target: WarningWarning You may need to get a job reference when starting a long-running encoding job, and need to check the job status on a thread.

trans-unit.source: In cases like this, when the method returns from a thread, you need to retrieve a refreshed reference to a job.
trans-unit.target: In cases like this, when the method returns from a thread, you need to retrieve a refreshed reference to a job.

trans-unit.source: As the number of assets you have in storage grows, it is helpful to list your assets.
trans-unit.target: As the number of assets you have in storage grows, it is helpful to list your assets.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to iterate through the Assets collection on the server context object.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows how to iterate through the Assets collection on the server context object.

trans-unit.source: With each asset, the code example also writes some of its property values to the console.
trans-unit.target: With each asset, the code example also writes some of its property values to the console.

trans-unit.source: For example, each asset can contain many media files.
trans-unit.target: For example, each asset can contain many media files.

trans-unit.source: The code example writes out all files associated with each asset.
trans-unit.target: The code example writes out all files associated with each asset.

trans-unit.source: An important related task is to list assets with their associated job in Media Services.
trans-unit.target: An important related task is to list assets with their associated job in Media Services.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows you how to list each IJob object, and then for each job, it displays properties about the job, all related tasks, all input assets, and all output assets.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows you how to list each IJob object, and then for each job, it displays properties about the job, all related tasks, all input assets, and all output assets.

trans-unit.source: The code in this example can be useful for numerous other tasks.
trans-unit.target: The code in this example can be useful for numerous other tasks.

trans-unit.source: For example, if you want to list the output assets from one or more encoding jobs that you ran previously, this code shows how to access the output assets.
trans-unit.target: For example, if you want to list the output assets from one or more encoding jobs that you ran previously, this code shows how to access the output assets.

trans-unit.source: When you have a reference to an output asset, you can then deliver the content to other users or applications by downloading it, or providing URLs.
trans-unit.target: When you have a reference to an output asset, you can then deliver the content to other users or applications by downloading it, or providing URLs.

trans-unit.source: For more information on options for delivering assets, see <linkText>Deliver Assets with the Media Services SDK for .NET</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on options for delivering assets, see <linkText>Deliver Assets with the Media Services SDK for .NET</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: In Media Services, you can define an access policy on an asset or its files.
trans-unit.target: In Media Services, you can define an access policy on an asset or its files.

trans-unit.source: An access policy defines the permissions for a file or an asset (what type of access, and the duration).
trans-unit.target: An access policy defines the permissions for a file or an asset (what type of access, and the duration).

trans-unit.source: In your Media Services code, you typically define an access policy by creating an IAccessPolicy object and then associating it with an existing asset.
trans-unit.target: In your Media Services code, you typically define an access policy by creating an IAccessPolicy object and then associating it with an existing asset.

trans-unit.source: Then you create a ILocator object, which lets you provide direct access to assets in Media Services.
trans-unit.target: Then you create a ILocator object, which lets you provide direct access to assets in Media Services.

trans-unit.source: The Visual Studio project that accompanies this documentation series contains several code examples that show how to create and assign access policies and locators to assets.
trans-unit.target: The Visual Studio project that accompanies this documentation series contains several code examples that show how to create and assign access policies and locators to assets.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to list all access policies on the server, and shows the type of permissions associated with each.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows how to list all access policies on the server, and shows the type of permissions associated with each.

trans-unit.source: Another useful way to view access policies is to list all ILocator objects on the server, and then for each locator, you can list its associated access policy by using its AccessPolicy property.
trans-unit.target: Another useful way to view access policies is to list all ILocator objects on the server, and then for each locator, you can list its associated access policy by using its AccessPolicy property.

trans-unit.source: A locator is a URL that provides a direct path to access an asset, along with permissions to the asset as defined by the locator's associated access policy.
trans-unit.target: A locator is a URL that provides a direct path to access an asset, along with permissions to the asset as defined by the locator's associated access policy.

trans-unit.source: Each asset can have a collection of ILocator objects associated with it on its Locators property.
trans-unit.target: Each asset can have a collection of ILocator objects associated with it on its Locators property.

trans-unit.source: The server context also has a Locators collection that contains all locators.
trans-unit.target: The server context also has a Locators collection that contains all locators.

trans-unit.source: The following code example lists all locators on the server.
trans-unit.target: The following code example lists all locators on the server.

trans-unit.source: For each locator, it shows the Id for the related asset and access policy.
trans-unit.target: For each locator, it shows the Id for the related asset and access policy.

trans-unit.source: It also displays the type of permissions, the expiration date, and the full path to the asset.
trans-unit.target: It also displays the type of permissions, the expiration date, and the full path to the asset.

trans-unit.source: Note that a locator path to an asset is only a base URL to the asset.
trans-unit.target: Note that a locator path to an asset is only a base URL to the asset.

trans-unit.source: To create a direct path to individual files that a user or application could browse to, your code must add the specific file path to the locator path.
trans-unit.target: To create a direct path to individual files that a user or application could browse to, your code must add the specific file path to the locator path.

trans-unit.source: For more information on how to do this, see the topic <linkText>Deliver Assets with the Media Services SDK for .NET</linkText><title></title>.
trans-unit.target: For more information on how to do this, see the topic <linkText>Deliver Assets with the Media Services SDK for .NET</linkText><title></title>.

trans-unit.source: The following example deletes an asset.
trans-unit.target: The following example deletes an asset.

trans-unit.source: To delete a job, you must check the state of the job as indicated in the State property.
trans-unit.target: To delete a job, you must check the state of the job as indicated in the State property.

trans-unit.source: Jobs that are finished or canceled can be deleted, while jobs that are in certain other states, such as queued, scheduled, or processing, must be canceled first, and then they can be deleted.
trans-unit.target: Jobs that are finished or canceled can be deleted, while jobs that are in certain other states, such as queued, scheduled, or processing, must be canceled first, and then they can be deleted.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows a method for deleting a job by checking job states and then deleting when the state is finished or canceled.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows a method for deleting a job by checking job states and then deleting when the state is finished or canceled.

trans-unit.source: This code depends on the previous section in this topic for getting a reference to a job: Get a job reference.
trans-unit.target: This code depends on the previous section in this topic for getting a reference to a job: Get a job reference.

trans-unit.source: The following code example shows how to get a reference to an access policy based on a policy Id, and then to delete the policy.
trans-unit.target: The following code example shows how to get a reference to an access policy based on a policy Id, and then to delete the policy.
